bibl.title: Letter from James E. Peabody to Howard A. Kelly, February 7, 1927

div1.p: Peabody writes about the failure of government assistance for Kissinger. The Association of Biology Teachers has also been unable to help.

div1.head: Letter from James E. Peabody to Howard A. Kelly, February 7, 1927

opener.dateline:
The Morris High School
166TH ST. AND BOSTON ROAD
NEW YORK CITY
----o----
THE MORRIS SERVICE LEAGUE
JAMES E. PEABODY
CHAIRMAN THE TEACHER'S COMMITTEE
Feb. 7, 1927.

div1.p:
The enclosed letter from
Mrs. Kissinger reached me
today. It is a pathetic appeal,
and I wish I could do some-
thing, but we feel our Assn.
of Biology Teachers and the individ-
ual teachers have done all we
can in the previous collections
we have taken. I hope you
can think of some some way
to helf. If you can, won't
you please communicate
directly with Mrs. Kissinger?
div1.closer:
Sincerely yours, J. E. Peabody.
P.S. They tell us there is no pos-
sibility of Gov't. help this session.
J.P.
